newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's AOM plans to fly solo now.
newsitem.headline: France's AOM plans to fly solo now.

text.p: French regional airline AOM said it would continue to operate on its own following a bid by British Airways Plc and bank Rivaud for ailing Air Liberte.
AOM, 99 percent owned by the Consortium de Realisation (CDR) which is selling assets of bank Credit Lyonnais, has been in merger talks with Air Liberte this year.
But the talks broke up due to the worsening financial situation at Air Liberte.
A spokeswoman for Air Liberte said the company's chairman Alexandre de Couvelaire now aimed to run the airline on its own while further reducing costs.
"There's British Airways, Groupe Air France and us. We have 10 to 12 percent of slots at Orly and we will go it alone," she said.
She denied widespread newspaper reports that Couvelaire had been dismissed and said he would stay on for "at least a number of months".
